intro: Ricinocarpus portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican ricinocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and palm-like appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Ricinocarpus portoricensis is adapted to coastal environments and is often found in sandy soils along the shores of Puerto Rico.
